intro: Stigmaphyllon lalandianum var. jussieuanum, commonly known as the Jussieuan stigmaphyllon, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
